# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

reasoning:
**The Shop: A Critical Appraisal**

Alright, let's take stock. Ante 7, Round 19. $78 in the bank. I've got a strong Flush build going, centered around "Four Fingers" for consistency. The real power is in these Uncommon Jokers: "Bootstraps" (essential money-to-mult), "To the Moon" (more interest, but already capped by my high balance), "Seltzer" (retriggers are clutch!), and "Vampire" (scaling X-Mult - currently sitting at a juicy X3.5). The "Baseball Card" is the glue, amplifying all the Uncommon Jokers (X7.59 currently). And let's not forget "Zany Joker" and "Hallucination," both adding slots and helping me fit everything in, though those negative effects will be a nuisance.

The shop itself? Cloud 9 is sitting there, but it's an Uncommon, and I'm jam-packed with Jokers. Buying it means selling something, and nothing in the shop justifies that. It's a non-starter. The Ace of Hearts? Nah, not worth the dollar when I could be spending on Bootstraps or interest. Rerolling is too expensive at this point. I need to keep that cash flowing.

The current setup is already hitting hard, easily reaching the Ante 7 thresholds. The "Cloud 9" is tempting due to the Baseball Card synergy but I can't spare any slots. There's just no way to make room for it. I am not seeing anything that's going to make my build significantly better.

I did a quick calculation: With Seltzer re-triggers, I'm easily looking at scores north of 200k+ per hand, even more if the Vampire keeps scaling. I'm safe. Rerolling a few times already, I am running a very strong setup for Ante 7. There's no value in buying Cloud 9 or Ace of Hearts.

Wait, I should check my slots before I finalize the build!

Okay, so the negative Jokers give me a total of 8 Joker slots, which is perfect because I have 8 Jokers. I cannot swap Cloud 9 without selling one of the core Uncommons.

Let's look at the Joker order: "Zany" then "Bootstraps" for the additive mult, then the utility Jokers. No need to swap the order of Jokers.

Okay, everything looks optimized. Time to hit "Round Select." Let's maximize that Bootstraps and interest! No need to hold the cards any longer.

I'm ready to move. This deck is optimized for scoring in the next round. Rerolling again would be throwing money away.

Final Decision: **`round_select`**.
